summary: study was to investigate the relationship between tumor necrosis factor (TNF)- gene polymorphisms with the occurrence of SARS-CoV infection and its role in prognosis of patients with lung interstitial fibrosis and femoral head osteonecrosis. TT genotype, CT and CC were found associated with a protective effect on SARS with ORs(95%CI) of 5.33(1.39–20.45) femoral head necrosis with OR(95%CI) of 6.42(1.53–26.88) and adjusted OR was 8.40(95%CI 1.76–40.02) in cured SARS patients compared to CC genotypes. but these SNPs may not affect interstitial lung fibrosis in cured SARS patients. a number of studies had shown that the TNF- promoter polymorphism had a significant effect on its transcriptional activity [6,7]. a number of studies had shown that the TNF- promoter polymorphism had a significant effect on its transcriptional activity. cytokines involved in pathogenesis of lung fibrosis have been found to over-expressed in regenerated type II pneumocytes in human lung. cytokines have been found to over-expressed in regenerated type II pneumocytes in human lung. femoral head necrosis was also observed in this population. 66 individuals had no contact history with SARS patients. 55 could be classified into severe and light SARS. this population also had the history of hormone therapy. genemic DNA extraction and polymerase chain reaction Leucocytes were isolated within 12 h of blood collection using Percoll reagent. PCRs contained 5 l(6.7 M) forward primer 5'-GATGGACTCACCAGGTGAG-3', 5 l(6.7 M) reverse primer 5'-CTCATGGTGTCCTTTCCAGG-3'. a thermal cycler sequenced the fragments in double directions using forward primer 5'-GATGGACTCACCAGGTGAG-3' and reverse primer 5'-CTCATGGTGTCCTTTCCAGG-3. the heterozygote genotype of each SNP site manifested as a single peak. methylprednisolone, deltadehydrocortisone and dexamethasone dosage were calculated into methylprednisolone using the following equation: 4 mg methylprednisolone = 5 mg deltadehydrocortisone = 0.75 mg dexamethasone. patients with interstitial lung fibrosis were diagnosed by respiratory experts. PCRs contained 5 l(6.7 M) forward primer 5'-GATGGACTCACCAGGTGAG-3', 5 l(6.7 M) reverse primer 5'-CTCATGGTGTCCTTTCCAGG-3', 5 l buffer [150 mm (NH4)2SO4, 500 mM Tris-Cl(pH = 8.8), 500 M EDTA-Na2,15 mM MgCl2,100 mM -Mercaptoethanol], total of 75 SARS patients, 41 health care workers and 66 individuals were included in this study. all the populations were Chinese Han ethnic. the mean age was 35.0 years for SARS, 35.7 for health care workers and 30.1 for individual controls. the CT genotype was less frequent in SARS group when compared with individual controls at the -204 locus (X2 = 4.20, P = 0.04) the genotype was associated with a protective effect on SARS with OR(95%CI) of 0.95(0.90–0.99) (Table 2). TNF- gene polymorphism in promoter region in cured SARS patients. CT and CC genotypes were more frequent in SARS patients with femoral head necrosis(53.7% and 6.7%, respectively) than in non-femoral head necrosis(20.0% and 0.0%, respectively) compared to TT genotype, CT and CC were found associated with a risk effect on femoral head necrosis with ORs(95%CI) of 5.33(1.39–20.45) and 5.67(2.74–11.71), respectively all the populations were Chinese Han ethnic. the mean age was 35.0 years for SARS, 35.7 for health care workers and 30.1 for individual controls. the proportion of male was 30.6% in SARS, 26.8% in health care workers and 69.5% in individual controls. 0.064 TNF- polymorphisms and interstitial lung fibrosis. there were no significant differences between interstitial lung fibrosis and non-interstitial lung fibrosis in SARS patients at promoter region of allele frequencies of TNF- gene were compared in SARS patients between femoral head necrosis and non-femoral head necrosis. the -1031 CT and CC genotypes were more frequent in SARS patients with femoral head necrosis(53.7% and 6.7%, respectively) CC genotype manifested as another risk effect associated with femoral head necrosis with OR(95%CI) of 6.42(1.53–26.88) adjusted OR was 8.40(95%CI 1.76–40.02) in cured SARS patients. allele distributions at -1031, -863, -857, -572, -238 and -163 were almost the same among the SARS, the health care workers and individual controls. but a higher A allele frequency in SARS population when compared with the control at the -308 locus(X2 = 8.96, P = 0.003) the -204 locus was a new discovered SNP site of TNF- promoter region. no apparent association between polymorphisms of TNF- promoter region with severity of SARS was observed. however, the role of TNF- gene in infectious diseases should be further studied. sis disease and IL-1 have been found to over-express in regenerating type II pneumocytes in human lung. idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis has been found to over-express in regenerating type II pneumocytes in human lung, thus enhancing fibroblast proliferation. -1031 CT and CC genotypes were more frequent in SARS patients with femoral head necrosis (53.7% and 6.7%, respectively) than in non-femoral head necrosis (20.0% and 0.0%, respectively) and CT and CC genotypes were related with a risk effect on femoral head necrosis with ORs (95%CI) of 5.33(1.39–20.45) there may be no association of TNF- polymorphisms in promoter region with SARS-Cov infection. however, the polymorphisms may no affect the occurrence of interstitial lung fibrosis in cured SARS patients.
